channel.title: 317 shutdown
channel.description: ohkay i host servers right, well i hosted a 508 for about a month now, but i want to go to a 317 its more stable, and easier to code, now i run the source and client and everything, and loging it works good, but i click 2-3 times on the game like to walk around, and it shuts me out of the client, it does it for eery client, but not 508 clients, help?

item.title: 317 shutdown
item.dc:creator: @bobbacar bobbacar
item.description:
@bobbacar wrote:

[quote="!Jake Whip!, post:14, topic:342454"]Here, put this in your runclient.bat for your client if your using windows 7.

@echo off cls "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit pause[/quote]

w0000000t thanks dude §! IT WORKED FOR ME :DDDDDDDDDDDDDDDDD

Read full topic

item.title: 317 shutdown
item.dc:creator: @b4k_2_lumby b4k 2 lumby
item.description:
@b4k_2_lumby wrote:

Try this ( Edit the run.bat )

@echo off title server java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

this is for the server side I put one for client now =S

Client sided ( Edit the run )

@echo off start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit

That should work =S

Read full topic

item.title: 317 shutdown
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:18, topic:342454”][quote author=frostscapeserver link=topic=438863.msg3225558#msg3225558 date=1275536171]
And if you don’t have a 2nd program files folder use this-

@echo off cls "C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit pause
[/quote]

jre? jre??? what the hell will jre do? ITS JDK! NOT JRE!!![/quote]

JRE: Java Runtime Environement. It contains the ‘java’ program. The JDK also contains the ‘java’ program. I prefer using the JDK’s ‘java’ because i need to use if for reloadable classes.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 shutdown
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:12, topic:342454”][quote author=Shorty626 link=topic=438863.msg3225178#msg3225178 date=1275514524]
It sounds like the server is dropping KeepAlive packets.
[/quote]

You’re a dumbass…

@OP: It’s not only a 64-bit Java problem. It’s ANY 317 client running on 64-bit Java. I repeat. IT’S ANY 317 CLIENT RUNNING ON 64-BIT JAVA.[/quote]I’ve never had any problems with it when I was using the 64bit Jvm, the problem emerged when trying to use the 32 bit java on a 64 bit computer.

Read full topic

item.title: 317 shutdown
item.dc:creator: @Shorty626 Shorty626
item.description:
@Shorty626 wrote:

Learn to read, and write whole words. There is nothing spelled incorrectly there.

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:10, topic:342454”][quote author=Shorty626 link=topic=438863.msg3225221#msg3225221 date=1275515969]
you don’t HAVE to use the the 64bit JRE. And pure ownage, I think you need to go study a bit because a lot of things here are inaccurate. When you install 64 bit applications, The files go into regular program files. The (X86) is for 32 bit applications. What makes you just suspect he has a 64bit system? His issue would aslo have nothing to do with the platform hes on.

[quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=438863.msg3225215#msg3225215 date=1275515801]

If you’re on a 64-bit system, you’ll have to download and use the 64-bit version of the Java Running Environment.
[/quote]and change the Program Files to Program Files(x86)

[/quote]l2spell then try to insult me.[/quote]

Read full topic
